StyleSheetList.summary: The StyleSheetList interface represents a list of objects. An instance of this object can be returned by .

remarks.para: It is an array-like object but can't be iterated over using methods. However it can be iterated over in a standard loop over its indices, or converted to an .

blockquote.para:
Typically list interfaces like StyleSheetList wrap around types, so you can use Array methods on them.
This is not the case here for historical reasons.
However, you can convert StyleSheetList to an Array in order to use those methods (see the example below).

StyleSheetListItem.summary: The item() method of the interface returns a single object.
StyleSheetListItem.returns: A object, or null if one does not exist for this index.

StyleSheetListLength.summary: The length read-only property of the interface returns the number of objects in the collection.
StyleSheetListLength.value: An integer indicating the number of items in the collection.
